text: To find yourself, think for yourself.
author: Socrates

text: Thought is so cunning, so clever, that it distorts everything for its own convenience.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: People are weird. When we find someone with weirdness that is compatible with ours, we team up and call it love.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Magic is believing in yourself, if you can do that, you can make anything happen.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Knowledge isn't power until it is applied.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: Don't ever save anything for a special occasion. Being alive is the special occasion.
author: Mary Engelbreit

text: To be totally at leisure for one day is to be immortal for one day.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: An inch of time is an inch of gold but you can't buy that inch of time with an inch of gold.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Talent is luck. The important thing in life is courage.
author: Woody Allen

text: You may forget with whom you laughed, but you will never forget with whom you wept.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: It will never rain roses: when we want to have more roses, we must plant more roses.
author: George Eliot

text: Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.
author: Marilyn Monroe

text: It's OK to have your eggs in one basket as long as you control what happens to that basket.
author: Elon Musk

text: A wise man will be master of his mind, a fool will be its slave.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
author: Carl Jung

text: However difficult life may seem, there is always something you can do and succeed at.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: Quiet people have the loudest minds.
author: Stephen King

text: Eighty percent of success is showing up.
author: Woody Allen

text: People inspire you, or they drain you. Pick them wisely.
author: Les Brown

text: The more perfect a person is on the outside, the more demons they have on the inside.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: The heart wants what it wants - or else it does not care.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: Be royal in your own fashion: act like a king to be treated like one.
author: Robert Greene

text: Life is like underwear, should be changed twice a day.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: First comes the shy wish. Then you must have the heart to have the dream. Then, you work, and work.
author: Estee Lauder

text: Rest in reason; move in passion.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: There's no scarcity of opportunity to make a living at what you love. There is only a scarcity of resolve to make it happen.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: If there is a book that you want to read, but it hasn't been written yet, then you must write it.
author: Toni Morrison

text: Originality is the fine art of remembering what you hear but forgetting where you heard it.
author: Laurence J. Peter

text: You have the freedom to be yourself, your true self, here and now, and nothing can stand in your way.
author: Richard Bach

text: The secret of perfect health lies in keeping the mind always cheerful - never worried, never hurried, never borne down by any fear, thought or anxiety.
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Ideas do not reach perfection in a day, no matter how much study is put upon them.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: Wise men speak because they have something to say; Fools because they have to say something.
author: Plato

text: Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more.
author: Nikola Tesla

text: Keep true. Never be ashamed of doing right. Decide what you think is right and stick to it.
author: George Eliot

text: We all give up great expectations along the way.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: Sometimes it is more important to discover what one cannot do, than what one can do.
author: Lin Yutang

text: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
author: Epictetus

text: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

text: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion. If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
author: Dalai Lama

text: The more reasons you have for achieving your goal, the more determined you will become.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Persistence. Perfection. Patience. Power. Prioritize your passion. It keeps you sane.
author: Criss Jami

text: Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.
author: Ayn Rand

text: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
author: Og Mandino

text: You must learn to let go. Release the stress. You were never in control anyway.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: To be fully alive is to feel that everything is possible.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.
author: Bodhidharma

text: What do we live for if not to make life less difficult for each other?
author: T.S. Eliot

text: If you've made a mistake, it's better just to laugh at it.
author: Zen Proverb

text: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: It's not about what it is, it's about what it can become.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Freeing oneself from words is liberation.
author: Bodhidharma

text: The first thing you learn in life is you're a fool. The last thing you learn in life is you're the same fool.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: The face is the mirror of the mind, and eyes without speaking confess the secrets of the heart.
author: St. Jerome

text: If what you're doing is not your passion, you have nothing to lose.
author: Celestine Chua

text: You don't need to be better than anyone else, you just need to be better than you used to be.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: The people who succeed are irrationally passionate about something.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Become the kind of leader that people would follow voluntarily, even if you had no title or position.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Believe in your infinite potential. Your only limitations are those you set upon yourself.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Don't Let Yesterday Take Up Too Much Of Today.
author: Will Rogers

text: Where there is no struggle, there is no strength.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Turn your face to the sun, as flowers know how to do.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Faith is taking the first step even when you don't see the whole staircase.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
author: Helen Keller

text: Once you learn to quit, it becomes a habit.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Leadership starts at the top.
author: Morgan Wootten

text: Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into the visible.
author: Tony Robbins

text: He who hesitates is a damned fool.
author: Mae West

text: FEAR has two meanings: 'Forget Everything And Run' or 'Face Everything And Rise.' The choice is yours.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: To be truly positive in the eyes of some, you have to risk appearing negative in the eyes of others.
author: Criss Jami

text: Whatever you do,strive to do it so well that no man living and no man dead and no man yet to be born could do it any better.
author: Benjamin Mays

text: Grudges are for those who insist that they are owed something; forgiveness, however, is for those who are substantial enough to move on.
author: Criss Jami

text: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.
author: Coco Chanel

text: People who belittle people, will be LITTLE people, and will accomplish very Little
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
author: Plato

text: If you truly love Nature, you will find beauty everywhere.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: Rewards and punishment is the lowest form of education.
author: Zhuangzi

text: Decide what your truth is. Then live it.
author: Kamal Ravikant

text: If you throw away all thoughts of attainment, you will then come to see the real purpose of your quest.
author: Seungsahn

text: Nothing you do is going to matter that much in the long run. Don't take yourself so seriously.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Be Brave and Take Risks: You need to have faith in yourself. Be brave and take risks. You don't have to have it all figured out to move forward.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: The primary cause of unhappiness is never the situation but your thoughts about it.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: As you grow older you will discover that you have two hands. One for helping yourself, the other for helping others.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Today you are you, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is you-er than you.
author: Dr. Seuss

text: Success is never final; failure is never fatal.
author: Conrad Hilton

text: Life is like playing the violin in public and learning the instrument as one goes on.
author: Samuel Butler

text: You don't need a weatherman to know which way the wind blows.
author: Bob Dylan

text: There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.
author: Plato

text: No matter what happens, always be yourself.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: No problem can be solved from the same level of consciousness that created it.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Here is the test to find whether your mission on earth is finished. If you're alive, it isn't.
author: Richard Bach

text: A vital part of the happiness formula is self-discipline. Whoever conquers himself knows deep happiness that fills the heart with joy.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: A dead thing can go with the stream, but only a living thing can go against it.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: There is no medicine like hope, no incentive so great, and no tonic so powerful as expectation of something tomorrow.
author: Orison Swett Marden

text: To think is easy. To act is hard. But the hardest thing in the world is to act in accordance with your thinking.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Those who know, do. Those that understand, teach.
author: Aristotle

text: I skate to where the puck is going to be, not where it has been.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: Everything begins with an idea.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: Where the willingness is great, the difficulties cannot be great.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

text: Be not afraid of growing slowly, be afraid only of standing still.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: When asked, how do you write? I invariably answer, one word at a time.
author: Stephen King

text: Patience is a bitter plant, but its fruit is sweet.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Live in each season as it passes; breathe the air, drink the drink, taste the fruit, and resign yourself to the influence of the earth.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: The more often a stupidity is repeated, the more it gets the appearance of wisdom.
author: Voltaire

text: Creative people are often found either disagreeable or intimidating by mediocrities.
author: Criss Jami

text: Where you are right now doesn't have to determine where you'll end up.
author: Barack Obama

text: Without education, we are in a horrible and deadly danger of taking educated people seriously.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
author: Plato

text: It is not uncommon for people to spend their whole life waiting to start living.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: What the eye doesn't see and the mind doesn't know, doesn't exist.
author: D. H. Lawrence

text: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
author: Henry Ford

text: The greatest doer must also be a great dreamer.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: You get paid in direct proportion to the difficulty of problems you solve.
author: Elon Musk

text: Is it really possible to tell someone else what one feels?
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: There will always be suffering. But we must not suffer over the suffering.
author: Alan Watts

text: A thing constructed can only be loved after it is constructed; but a thing created is loved before it exists.
author: Charles Dickens

text: My mind seems to have become a kind of machine for grinding general laws out of large collections of facts.
author: Charles Darwin

text: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
author: Epictetus

text: Life is a constant series of opportunities.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Whatever you think the world is withholding from you, you are withholding from the world.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: Don't bother people for help without first trying to solve the problem yourself.
author: Colin Powell

text: Life is what you make it. Always has been, always will be.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Change is hardest at the beginning, messiest in the middle and best at the end.
author: Robin Sharma

text: A simple rule in dealing with those who are hard to get along with is to remember that this person is striving to assert his superiority; and you must deal with him from that point of view.
author: Alfred Adler

text: Heal the past, live the present, dream the future.
author: Mary Engelbreit

text: It's very strange that the people you love are often the people you're most cruel to.
author: Kenneth Branagh

text: People tend to complicate their own lives, as if living weren't already complicated enough.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: An intelligence test sometimes shows a man how smart he would have been not to have taken it.
author: Laurence J. Peter

text: Exceptional thinkers ignore their critics and go about their business making history.
author: John Eliot

text: Hope is not a strategy. Luck is not a factor. Fear is not an option.
author: James Cameron

text: Reading should be a pleasure, not a chore.
author: Joan Rivers

text: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.
author: William James

text: To know your Enemy, you must become your Enemy.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Awaken. Take heed, do not squander your life.
author: Dogen

text: When you say yes to change, you are choosing to navigate that path peacefully and happily and see where it takes you.
author: Sonia Ricotti

text: Any idea, plan, or purpose may be placed in the mind through repetition of thought.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: We are shaped and fashioned by what we love.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: It's beautiful to be alone. To be alone does not mean to be lonely. It means the mind is not influenced and contaminated by society.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: Learning never exhausts the mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Your greatest asset is your earning ability. Your greatest resource is your time.
author: Brian Tracy

text: The more we value things, the less we value ourselves.
author: Bruce Lee

text: I love fools' experiments. I am always making them.
author: Charles Darwin

text: Thinking is the hardest work there is, which is probably the reason why so few engage in it.
author: Henry Ford

text: An approximate answer to the right question is worth a great deal more than a precise answer to the wrong question.
author: John Tukey

text: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: We have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: To be able to forget means sanity.
author: Jack London

text: Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it.
author: Rumi

text: Life can be wonderful if you're not afraid of it.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: By the practice of meditation, you will find that you are carrying within your heart a portable paradise.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: I am who I am today because of the choices I made yesterday.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: If you want to make God laugh, tell him about your plans.
author: Woody Allen

text: We have to walk in a way that we only print peace and serenity on the Earth. Walk as if you are kissing the Earth with your feet.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: Do all things with love.
author: Og Mandino

text: Do something to move yourself toward your major goal every day.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
author: Thomas Edison

text: When you can't make them see the light, make them feel the heat.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: A person hears only what they understand.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to reform.
author: Mark Twain

text: Confidence is like a dragon where, for every head cut off, two more heads grow back.
author: Criss Jami

text: The attempt to escape from pain, is what creates more pain.
author: Gabor Mate

text: Never fear quarrels, but seek hazardous adventures.
author: Alexandre Dumas

text: If you can change your mind, you can change your life.
author: William James

text: There is no such thing as a great talent without great willpower.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity, and responsibility to give something back by becoming more.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Live your life and forget your age.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: No one returns from a long journey the same person they were before.
author: Zen Proverb

text: When you're the only sane person, you look like the only insane person.
author: Criss Jami

text: Dreams are the royal road to the unconscious.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: With self-discipline, almost anything is possible.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Sometimes, the only way to evolve is to open ourselves fully.
author: Kamal Ravikant

text: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
author: Audrey Hepburn

text: It's much better to do good in a way that no one knows anything about it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: Wherever there is danger, there lurks opportunity; wherever there is opportunity, there lurks danger. The two are inseparable.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: When obstacles arise, you change your direction to reach your goal; you do not change your decision to get there.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: When you have vision it affects your attitude. Your attitude is optimistic rather than pessimistic.
author: Charles Swindoll

text: Just do the best you can. No one can do more than that.
author: John Wooden

text: Tomorrow is only found in the calendar of fools.
author: Og Mandino

text: Successful people do what unsuccessful people are not willing to do.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Just trust that everything is unfolding the way it is supposed to. Don't resist... Great things are waiting for you around the corner.
author: Sonia Ricotti

text: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Every night before going to sleep, we must ask ourselves: what weakness did I overcome today? What virtue did I acquire?
author: Seneca

text: Intelligence is the ability to adapt to change.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: I do not exist to impress the world. I exist to live my life in a way that will make me happy.
author: Richard Bach

text: Man should fear never beginning to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: You talk when you cease to be at peace with your thoughts.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.
author: Lao Tzu

text: As soon as you trust yourself, you will know how to live.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: It's necessary to get the losers out of your life if you want to live your dream.
author: Les Brown

text: Don't measure yourself by what you have accomplished, but by what you should have accomplished with your ability.
author: John Wooden

text: Never was anything great achieved without danger.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

text: A mentor is someone who sees more talent and ability within you, than you see in yourself, and helps bring it out of you.
author: Bob Proctor

text: There are no limitations to the mind except those we acknowledge...
author: Napoleon Hill

text: If it is not right, do not do it, if it is not true, do not say it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves.
author: Confucius

text: If everyone is moving forward together, then success takes care of itself.
author: Henry Ford

text: Difficult roads often lead to beautiful destinations.
author: Unknown

text: Motivation gets you going and habit gets you there.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: No snowflake ever falls in the wrong place.
author: Zen Proverb

text: Natural talent only determines the limits of your athletic potential. It's dedication and a willingness to discipline your life that makes you great.
author: Billie Jean King

text: It's not whether you get knocked down, its whether you get back up.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Knowledge is learning something everyday. Wisdom is letting go of something everyday.
author: Unknown

text: Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

text: Do not regret the past. Look to the future.
author: Soyen Shaku

text: Believe in one thing too much and you have no room for new ideas.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

text: Time is more valuable than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time.
author: Jim Rohn

text: When you want to be honored by others, you learn to honor them first.
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: Be kind whenever possible. It is always possible.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Only the hand that erases can write the true thing.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: The best dreams happen when you're awake.
author: Cherie Gilderbloom

text: The present moment is filled with joy and happiness. If you are attentive, you will see it.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: Change begets change. Nothing propagates so fast.
author: Charles Dickens

text: It is truth that liberates, not your effort to be free.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: The only people without problems are those in cemeteries.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Amateurs sit and wait for inspiration, the rest of us just get up and got to work.
author: Stephen King

text: An ounce of performance is worth pounds of promises.
author: Mae West

text: No one ever said life was fair. Just Eventful.
author: Carol Burnett

text: I was wise enough to never grow up while fooling most people into believing I had.
author: Margaret Mead

text: Whatever satisfies the soul is truth.
author: Walt Whitman

text: It is useless to attempt to reason a man out of a thing he was never reasoned into.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: To understand the heart and mind of a person, look not at what he has already achieved, but at what he aspires to.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: We ourselves feel that what we are doing is just a drop in the ocean. But the ocean would be less because of that missing drop.
author: Mother Teresa

text: If you want things to be different, perhaps the answer is to become different yourself.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: Unless you change how you are, you will always have what you got.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace and gratitude.
author: Denis Waitley

text: When people are free to do as they please, they usually imitate each other.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: Don't try to be young. Just open your mind. Stay interested in stuff.
author: Betty White

text: Every day passes whether you participate or not.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Silence is a source of great strength.
author: Lao Tzu

text: There's more to life than being a passenger.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: You are not only responsible for what you say, but also for what you do not say.
author: Martin Luther

text: Don't set your own goals by what other people make important.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: He who loses wealth loses much; he who loses a friend loses more; but he that loses his courage loses all.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

text: It's not what you pay a man, but what he costs you that counts.
author: Will Rogers

text: Optimism, when applied to your life, develops strength and peace within you.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: Nothing is easier than fault finding.
author: Og Mandino

text: The giving of love is an education in itself.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt
